Computers are devices that can store and process information related to arithmetic, logic, programs, systems, hardware, and more
They are used to control a variety of products, from simple special-purpose devices to complex factory devices and general-purpose devices like PCs and smartphones
The Internet, which connects billions of computers and users, is powered by computers
People have used manual instruments like the abacus to do calculations since ancient times
During the Industrial Revolution, mechanical devices were built to automate tedious tasks
In the early 20th century, electrical machines did analog calculations

Digital electronic calculating machines were developed during WWII, followed by semiconductor transistors and monolithic integrated circuit chip technologies in the late 1950s, leading to the microprocessor and microcomputer revolution in the 1970s
This sparked the Digital Revolution, with transistor counts increasing rapidly (as predicted by Moore's law)
